Key Match Events: Brayan Bello allowed just two hits and a walk while striking out nine over eight scoreless innings in a 3-0 victory over the Toronto Blue Jays.
Pre-Game Insights: Brayan Bello struggled with a 5.32 ERA in the first half of the season but has improved significantly, lowering his ERA under 5.00 in the second half.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Alex Cora praised Bello's performance, noting his use of various pitches effectively.
Bello expressed his desire to help the team advance towards the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bello had never recorded an out in the eighth inning in 63 career starts, but he did so on Wednesday.
The win helped the Red Sox pull within three games of the third wild-card spot.
